required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Anticoagulation for Stroke Prevention In Patients With Recent Episodes of Perioperative Atrial Fibrillation After Noncardiac Surgery - The ASPIRE-AF Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Pilot study of oral anticoagulation versus no anticoagulation for the prevention of stroke and other adverse cardiovascular events in patients with transient perioperative atrial fibrillation after noncardiac surgery and additional stroke risk factors.

detailed_description.textblock: ASPIRE-AF is a prospective, randomized, open-label trial to assess the feasibility of a randomized controlled trial of non-vitamin K oral anticoagulants (NOACs) versus no anticoagulation in patients with transient perioperative atrial fibrillation after noncardiac surgery and additional stroke risk factors. The primary objective is to assess the feasibility of a randomized controlled trial of NOACs versus no anticoagulation in patients with perioperative atrial fibrillation after noncardiac surgery and additional stroke risk factors.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective, randomized, open-label clinical trial with blinded outcome assessment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants to Complete Recruitment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 months, until final follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Recruit 100 patients at an average recruitment rate of 1 patient per centre per month

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 months, until final follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Achieve complete follow-up on 90% more of patients

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 months, until final follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Determine resource requirements to achieve recruitment and follow-up goals

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 months, until final follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Determine feasibility of administering oral anticoagulation

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Non-hemorrhagic stroke or systemic embolism
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 months, until final follow-up
Up to 24 months, until final follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Hospitalization for congestive heart failure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 months, until final follow-up

other_outcome.description: Effects of NOACs on the change in Montreal Cognitive Assessment scores (range between 0-30 points)

other_outcome.measure: Safety objective: incidence of composite of life-threatening, major, and critical organ bleeding
other_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 months, until final follow-up
other_outcome.description: as previously used in the MANAGE trial

other_outcome.measure: Safety objective: incidence of major bleeding
other_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 months, until final follow-up

other_outcome.measure: Safety objective: incidence of hemorrhagic stroke
other_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 months, until final follow-up

arm_group.description: Patients allocated to the no anticoagulation arm are not allowed to receive oral anticoagulation, unless the patient develops an indication for its use during follow-up.

intervention.intervention_name: Investigators can choose from one of four Non-vitamin K oral anticoagulants (NOACs): Edoxaban 60mg daily, Apixaban 5mg twice daily, Dabigatran 110mg twice daily, or, Rivaroxaban 20mg daily.
intervention.description: Daily administration from time of randomization to final follow-up

facility.name: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal
